
Alice sent Bob a secret message encrypted using RSA, but used a modulus that is a Blum integer. Can you recover her message? Ciphertext: 4009119422993606150718731537333581111673778978803374242896169561138397586425904576098531138433423182414759339335551009562463468615602596933222704512260022


The flag format is flag{...}
n=10557664895301131409813891264635890919753353655188723226305065169259815326107252203486026229137478779196752576386319555090879868446295369782196025926664917, e=230311640242817115144644448327440541272404638795951574568452992797459911490290877110583958658712933824641913732866621333859257107254872532494425867047463
The lower 104 bits of p are: 39105395786463696029381850224499047611


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{mhzljvq7}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4009119422993606150718731537333581111673778978803374242896169561138397586425904576098531138433423182414759339335551009562463468615602596933222704512260022
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10557664895301131409813891264635890919753353655188723226305065169259815326107252203486026229137478779196752576386319555090879868446295369782196025926664917, e=230311640242817115144644448327440541272404638795951574568452992797459911490290877110583958658712933824641913732866621333859257107254872532494425867047463
The lower 104 bits of p are: 39105395786463696029381850224499047611

extra_info: p=109135014283472421215344140717327463111243101500376081171261172662568512076987, q=96739483332802393211247191801424350507004574688427065944950055548780020649391, Ï†(n)=10557664895301131409813891264635890919753353655188723226305065169259815326107046328988409954323052187864233824572701307414691065299179158553984677393938540
